p: Several reports emphasize on the use of medicinal plants and polyphenols to prevent oxidative stress damage notably in red blood cells [ 24, 51, 52, 53, 54]. Oxidative stress affects membrane stability and fluidity [ 55]. To reproduce the conditions of an oxidative stress, AAPH was added to purified human red blood cells. Interactions between red blood cell membrane polyunsaturated fatty acids and AAPH-derived free radicals leads to membrane rupture and eventually hemolysis (detectable through a progressive decrease in optical density at 450 nm) [ 56]. In our study, the ability of plant preparations to protect red blood cells against oxidative stress was assessed by performing a hemolysis inhibition test.
